then add it in there

item.source: Oh dear you died in clan wars...?

item.title: Oh dear you died in clan wars...?
item.dc:creator: @woofdawg23 woofdawg23
item.description:
@woofdawg23 wrote:

[quote=“caboose420, post:2, topic:179790”]i had the same problem with my server and i used that same coding u used from someone who made a tutorial about it and it dosn’t work i know that off the back of my hand, back to matter at hand tho, i had the same problem you’re having so i decided to make my own way to making it work and i made it work just thinking of ideas for and i found myself to be better than the tutorial so let me find the coding i used to make my own area where u don’t loose items give me about 5 minutes.

it also annoys me that people don’t want to help others when they need help and i’m the only person with the common decentcy to help others.

EDIT:
heres you’re fix i hope

ok make this coding

[code]public boolean loseNoItems() {
if(absX >= 3330 && absX <= 3359 && absY >= 3204 && absY <=

return true;
else
	return false;

}[/code]

look like this

public void loseNoItems() { if((absX >= 3330 && absX <= 3359 && absY >= 3204 && absY <= 3221)) }

and put it right under

public class client extends Player implements Runnable {

then look for

public void initialize()

or

public boolean initialize()

i got the void not the boolean so odds are you’ll have the same unless ur using a diffrent source that use’s it as a boolean

anyways once ur at that void/boolean scroll down untill you find you’re welcome message’s like i have mine, mine look like this

if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("blablabla")) { PlayerHandler.messageToAll = "SERVER OWNER blablabla IS ONLINE START BEHAVING!"; }

if it’s not the same then just change the

blablabla

to whatevery you have your’s set to and the

PlayerHandler.messageToAll = "SERVER OWNER blablabla IS ONLINE START BEHAVING!";

dosn’t have to be in ur line of coding thats just what i have lol

and under that last } that you see in the code above simply just add this under it

loseNoItems();

if you can’t find the welcome message that you see above just try putting the

loseNoItems();

right under you’re

public void initialize()

so it looks something like this

public void initialize() { loseNoItems();

or if you’re { is in antoher place it might look like this

public void initialize() {

if thats the case then just add the

loseNoItems();

under

public void initialize() {

to make it look like this

public void initialize() { loseNoItems();

and the hopefully u wont loose items when u die in that sertian area that u have coded if it dosn’t work or if u get any errors post’em i’ll try to help fix for ya, i tryed making this as simple as i could so thats why it’s kinda long lol

R3P++ would be very apreciated[/quote]weni die i still lose itemz?

Read full topic

@caboose420 wrote:

i had the same problem with my server and i used that same coding u used from someone who made a tutorial about it and it dosn’t work i know that off the back of my hand, back to matter at hand tho, i had the same problem you’re having so i decided to make my own way to making it work and i made it work just thinking of ideas for and i found myself to be better than the tutorial so let me find the coding i used to make my own area where u don’t loose items give me about 5 minutes.

it also annoys me that people don’t want to help others when they need help and i’m the only person with the common decentcy to help others.

EDIT:
heres you’re fix i hope

ok make this coding

[code]public boolean loseNoItems() {
if(absX >= 3330 && absX <= 3359 && absY >= 3204 && absY <=

return true;
else
	return false;

}[/code]

look like this

public void loseNoItems() { if((absX >= 3330 && absX <= 3359 && absY >= 3204 && absY <= 3221)) }

and put it right under

public class client extends Player implements Runnable {

then look for

public void initialize()

or

public boolean initialize()

i got the void not the boolean so odds are you’ll have the same unless ur using a diffrent source that use’s it as a boolean

anyways once ur at that void/boolean scroll down untill you find you’re welcome message’s like i have mine, mine look like this

if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("blablabla")) { PlayerHandler.messageToAll = "SERVER OWNER blablabla IS ONLINE START BEHAVING!"; }

if it’s not the same then just change the

blablabla

to whatevery you have your’s set to and the

PlayerHandler.messageToAll = "SERVER OWNER blablabla IS ONLINE START BEHAVING!";

dosn’t have to be in ur line of coding thats just what i have lol

and under that last } that you see in the code above simply just add this under it

loseNoItems();

if you can’t find the welcome message that you see above just try putting the

loseNoItems();

right under you’re

public void initialize()

so it looks something like this

public void initialize() { loseNoItems();

or if you’re { is in antoher place it might look like this

public void initialize() {

if thats the case then just add the

loseNoItems();

under

public void initialize() {

to make it look like this

public void initialize() { loseNoItems();

and the hopefully u wont loose items when u die in that sertian area that u have coded if it dosn’t work or if u get any errors post’em i’ll try to help fix for ya, i tryed making this as simple as i could so thats why it’s kinda long lol

R3P++ would be very apreciated

item.title: Oh dear you died in clan wars...?
item.dc:creator: @woofdawg23 woofdawg23
item.description:
@woofdawg23 wrote:

Ok all i did was add this.

if(loseNoItems()) { teleportToX = 3487; teleportToY = 3090; heightLevel = 0; //pEmote = 15; //pWalk = 13; sendMessage("Oh dear you died in clanwars!"); hitDiff = 0; updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; } else if(!loseNoItems()) { }

after this…

public void youdied() {

And it compiles successfully.

then i added this.

[code]public boolean loseNoItems() {
if(absX >= 3330 && absX <= 3359 && absY >= 3204 && absY <=

return true;
else
	return false;

}[/code]

under this.

public class client extends Player implements Runnable {

then compiled and it compiled successfully. But whenever i pk at that certain spot where ur not “suppose” to lose items, u lose items!!!

and when you die it says this.

Oh dear you died in clanwars! Oh dear you lost all your items... Oh dear you died in clanwars! Oh dear you lost all your items...

any1 help?

Read full topic
